resources.string: Connection failed, please check your network connection
We could not log you in because your clock settings appear to be incorrect. Please check your clock and try again.
Fail to login, please try again.
Location data is used for trajectory recording.
Microphone is used for sound level analysis.
Notification is used to indicate the app is currently reading your sensor data.

Via Quick Start

1. Tap the green play button on the main screen.
2. Grant permission when prompted (only once).
3. The button turns red and a popup says "Recording Started".
4. Your journey is now being logged automatically.
5. To stop, tap the red button again. It will turn green.

Via Sensor Settings

1. Tap the profile icon > Sensor Settings.
2. Toggle the sensors you want to use.
3. Check the descriptions under each sensor to understand what it tracks.
4. Tap "Start Recording" at the top.
5. Grant permissions only for selected sensors.
6. You may leave the page. It keeps recording.
7. To stop, return and tap "Stop Recording".
What do the icons and colors mean?
When the app starts, the map auto-focuses on your most current location. Tap the positioning button to recenter anytime.
• Pinch to zoom in or out.\n• Drag with one finger to move around the map.\n• Double tap to quickly zoom in.
Tap on a session pin to view its details. Colored lines reflect session activity, and timestamps help track when events occurred.
How do I use the map?
The map displays your movement as colored trajectory lines. Markers indicate start and end points, and a blue dot shows your current location.
Learn how to explore and interact with your timeline map.
Tip: Sessions can also be accessed from the bottom timeline bar on the home screen.
Colored paths: your recorded routes with different transport modes.\nTap it to view more info.
• Travel mode icons show how you moved (e.g., walking, bus).\n• Total time per transport is displayed beside its icon.\n• Timestamps and location names show the order and duration of stops.
Need more help? Tap the Help icon in the top-right menu to contact support or revisit tutorials.
We\'re working on a feature that gives you weekly insights and trends. Stay tuned via the Help or About page for updates.

New to Timeline? Don’t worry — tooltips will guide you through key features the first time you use the app. These popups explain buttons, panels, and map tools.\n\nYou can dismiss tips anytime, and even revisit them later through Help > About .

When enabled, this feature automatically starts sensor recording the moment you open the app — no need to tap any buttons. 

You can toggle this in Timeline Settings > Auto-Start Recording.

This is ideal if you want seamless, passive tracking without manual input.

Your data stays on your device unless you choose to export it. You can delete sessions anytime under Timeline Settings > Location History.

• Set auto-delete timeframes
• Manually clear sessions by date
You're always in control.

While the app works out of the box, you can fine-tune it to suit your needs. Go to Sensor Settings to:

• Enable/disable specific sensors
• Adjust sampling frequency
• Reduce battery usage by disabling unused sensors

This ensures you're collecting only what matters to you.

Your movement history is grouped by date and session in the bottom drawer of the main screen. Each session shows:

• Where and when you moved
• How long you stayed in one place
• A visual trajectory line connecting your points

This helps you recall where you've been.
View Past Sessions at a Glance
Timeline offers more than just basic tracking. It’s designed to help you make sense of your movements, reflect on your journeys, and manage your data easily.
Have questions? Here are some helpful answers.
What happens if I don’t grant permi ssion for some sensors?
If you deny permission for a sensor, that sensor will be disabled during recording. Other enabled sensors will continue functioning. You can always enable them later in Sensor Settings.
Will my data be automatical ly deleted?
No. All session data stays on your device and the cloud until you manually delete it via the Timeline Settings page.
How is my recording data stored?
Your data is stored locally and in the cloud, session by session. It includes movement data, time intervals, and optional sensor input.
What insights can I gain from using this app?
You’ll see where you’ve been, how you traveled, how long you stayed, and how often you return to places. It’s a helpful way to reflect on routines, mobility, and travel time.
How do I delete my data manually?
Navigate to the User Menu > Timeline Settings. There, you’ll find options to delete specific sessions or clear all history.
What happens if I force stop the app while recording?
If the app is force stopped, recording will still running in background until you stop it manually.
Why is the map not showing my full route?
This may be due to GPS signal issues, battery optimization settings, or missing permissions. Make sure the app has location access and is not being restricted in the background.
Timeline collects your GPS location periodically and logs time spent at places.
Understand what Timeline does and how it helps you track movement.
Timeline is a smart location tracker that automatically logs where you’ve been, when, and for how long.
Great for fieldwork, travel logs, or daily tracking. Your data stays on your device unless you choose to share it.
Where can I see my timeline?
The timeline history can be viewed from the map on the main page. More details for individual trip can be found from the bottom sheet or by clicking the trajectory on map.
Timeline helps you reflect on your movement patterns by storing daily history with detailed trajectories.
Swipe left or right on the horizontal date bar above the map to select a different day. Each date loads its own set of tracked data.
Your movements are displayed as a line connecting GPS points on the map. You can zoom in or tap on parts of the path for more context.
Swipe up the bottom sheet to view summaries of recorded sessions, start and end times, and distances travelled.
Need more help? Tap the Help icon in the top-right menu to revisit guides or contact support.
Track your movement using the recording button on the main screen.
Recording activates your device’s sensors and location to track your movement over time. These are saved as sessions you can view later.
Screenshot of the recording button on the main screen
Screenshot of the sensor settings recording screen
Your recorded data appears in the timeline bar and map view. You can explore each session, view trajectories, and check time intervals.
Tip: Once recording starts, you can freely navigate the app or even lock your screen. Data will continue to log in the background until stopped.
Learn what each sensor does and why it’s used.
Tracks how your device moves—used to detect steps, shakes, or orientation.
Estimates your movement type—walking, cycling, or stationary—for smarter context tracking.
Measures the force of gravity acting on the device—helps determine tilt, orientation, and motion when combined with other sensors.
Tracks your phone’s rotation. Often used with the accelerometer to better understand movement.
Records where you are. Enables route tracking, trip summaries, and map visualization.
Measures the strength and direction of Earth’s magnetic field—used to determine compass orientation and detect nearby metal objects.
Captures ambient sound levels—used to understand noise exposure (no recordings stored).
Senses the lighting around your device—can help detect ambient brightness or daylight exposure.
Detects the amount of moisture in the air—helpful for analyzing comfort, climate, or indoor air quality.
Measures atmospheric pressure—commonly used to estimate altitude, detect weather changes, or enhance location precision.
All data is stored locally unless you choose to share it. You can review or disable any sensor in Settings.
Every walk, train ride, and detour saved automatically, just for you!
Spot trends, not just timestamps. Know how you move, be it by foot, MRT, car, or bike.
Prefer quiet tracking? Want the full breakdown? Choose what Timeline records and when.\n\nYou\'re in charge!
This page will help you do the set up, learn the basics, and start logging your journey automatically with Timeline.
Sign in or create an account to save preferences, link your data, and sync across devices securely..
Timeline uses your device\'s GPS and motion sensors. Grant location permission when prompted to ensure accurate tracking.
Go to Sensor Settings to enable sensors like location, movement, or battery. Toggle only what’s useful to you.
Tap the floating “Start Recording” button on the main screen or from the Timeline Settings page to begin logging your movements.
Swipe up the bottom sheet on the map to see daily summaries. Tap a date to explore detailed movement sessions..
Need more help? Tap the Help icon in the top-right menu to contact support or revisit tutorials.
